text_Original: I think one of the most interesting side effects of having your foto-realistic face as the way you interact with people over the web is its de-masking effect it has, which is contrary to the standard distance (of a screen) and the anonymity baked into the current web. If you're familiar with the negative effects of sunglasses or face paint on soldiers and how it can lead to cruelty, then you might suspect the distance we have between one another on the web has a similar effect considering all its toxicity. So, this new meta-verse might just lead to a kinder internet.

If you're familiar with the negative effects of sunglasses or face paint on soldiers and how it can lead to cruelty, then you might suspect the distance we have between one another on the web has a similar effect considering all its toxicity. So, this new meta-verse might just lead to a kinder internet.

text_Original:
🎯 Key Takeaways for quick navigation:

00:00 🌐 Metaverse allows photorealistic avatars with 3D spatial audio for immersive interactions.
02:45 📷 Kodak avatars capture realistic emotions and expressions.
05:30 💡 Future: smartphone avatar scans and integration into applications.
10:42 🕶️ Quest 3 introduces mixed reality for various experiences.
13:55 👥 Mixed reality enables remote collaboration and blending digital with reality.
16:54 🎮 Quest 3 offers affordability, better graphics, and safety features.
20:09 👁️ Complex AI blends real and digital worlds, revolutionizing innovation.
21:05 📷 Metaverse tech tracks physical world and hand gestures.
21:34 🎹 Piano demo showcases seamless physical-digital integration.
22:01 👥 Photorealistic avatars offer ultra-realistic experiences.
23:27 💼 Tech bridges physical and digital realms.
24:38 🕹️ Objects can become interactive holograms.
25:05 🤝 Mixed Hangouts combine physical and holographic participants.
26:12 🤖 Preference for photorealistic vs. expressive avatars remains uncertain.
28:21 🧐 Acceptance of various avatars raises identity questions.
32:44 👥 Interacting with deceased loved ones in Metaverse sparks ethical questions.
35:00 🤖 AI versions of oneself extend presence and engagement.
38:15 🤖 Meta AI enhances tasks and interactions in different settings.
39:13 🕹️ AI personalities enrich gaming experiences.
41:08 🤯 Creating AI personalities requires accuracy and respect.
42:34 🤖 Challenge: Making AI assistants predictable and setting parameters.
44:28 🛡️ Metaverse's surreal blend of physical and digital realities.
46:19 💼 Future: Seamless blend of physical and digital worlds.
47:31 🤔 Determining what's allowed in the metaverse, addressing digital actions vs. physical harm.
49:22 📜 Anonymity and ethical behavior in the metaverse.
50:46 🌐 Metaverse redefines remote work with physical presence.
54:14 🧠 Acknowledgment of Llama 2 success and hints at Llama 3.
56:08 🤖 Community creativity shapes the metaverse's potential.
58:40 🌟 Profound shift in reality perception in the metaverse.
01:02:17 🌐 Metaverse promises immersive experiences beyond current platforms.

text_Original: Take away:  You "try to do your best to mitigate"... oh and all your lobby crew is working day and night to keep it UNREGULATED Mark.  Where is our vote?   This blossoming of billionaires is the most novel expression of our madness.  We have countless problems with poverty, housing, climate crisis and this guy is still trying to make life into a game.  Well -- maybe the rich are right and Argentina wealth inequality and most people poor or living on the streets obeying the dicktator is the future.  But not if we still get a vote.  Let's vote on AI, let's vote on taxing billionaires until they're millionaires.   Enough with trying to act like this is just Normy Normal ignoring all the suffering in the world so a few white boys can gamify terminal civilization.  step away from your screens and go make some friends, because Zuck isn't.  Oh and when I say taxes I mean corporations today pay 6% income taxes.  Eisenhower Republican President in the 50's?  90% tax rate on wealth and a 50% income tax on corporations to force them to invest in research, development and jobs.   We want an abundance of $75K jobs in society so you have time to chill, time to play, rest and be social.

text_Original: He Lex, a comment to 45:23somthing. I am a little bit older then you. The C64 Generation and 32k Modems. I thought there where a limit also for a long time. I lost that when the first Iphone came out. I never had any apple product but i was in the android system. And then i realized, it will never stops again. Maybe when we blow us out or out of the solar system. There mayby some limits we can envolve above, good or bad, but i don´t see any in the near future. It´s funny  i started in 1996 with our business because i was good in 3dsmax and other programms. And now 25 years later. 3D comes actualy to live in WEB3 and VR and i don´t know anything about it anymore. I know html, css, php and so on, but my passion in 3D comes now to live and i realy don´t know anything about it today. I followed it, and saw it grow, but it never realy crossed over to my work as a webdesigner i am today. But there is hope. Web3 and beyond  is going  to be 3d and more. I hope i can catch up. I love to bring things alive that i dreamed up 25 years ago.

text_Original:
I think it will go the same way as all advancements. Still, nothing will replace real physical interaction. 

Phones came along, mind blowing that you could actually hear someone’s real voice from a different place entirely. 

Enter video, same again. 

Video chat, call, social media. We are more ‘connected’ than ever but nothing will ever replace, really being on that beach, with real beer and your real actual friend who is hugging you back.
text_Display:
I think it will go the same way as all advancements. Still, nothing will replace real physical interaction.

Phones came along, mind blowing that you could actually hear someone’s real voice from a different place entirely.

Enter video, same again.

Video chat, call, social media. We are more ‘connected’ than ever but nothing will ever replace, really being on that beach, with real beer and your real actual friend who is hugging you back.

text_Original: I honestly don't believe that there is a morally excusable reason to pursue this technology. It is a delusion of the grandest scale, but within a technological realm. Additionally, the hype and attention this is receiving is not proportionate to the value it has in the current state of the world. It is better to live in the now than to live in a future that probably won't happen because not enough attention was put into the present problems.

text_Original:
I think the real world is much more fascinating & interesting than virtual reality. Real people are so much more alive & interesting than their avatars. Real life is more difficult than virtual life, and real challenges happen in it, like suffering, death, and grief, no matter how much we try to escape from them.
What's wrong with real reality for some people that they readily want to inhabit virtual realities?
It puzzles me.
I don't get it.
Imitations aren't real. They are adjustable, multifunctional& exacting realisations of fantasies but who wants to have ever exciting but non real life, an illusion  over real life and get addicted to it wasting a real life & not meeting of its challenges, responsibilities & difficulties, which are occasions for growth.
Real-life challenges are real & there isn't escape from reality & real feelings, no matter how perfect this thing will become in imitating real life.
I don't buy into it.
My real life is interesting and challenging enough to choose to resort to virtual escapism & fun.
text_Display:

It puzzles me.
I don't get it.
Imitations aren't real. They are adjustable, multifunctional& exacting realisations of fantasies but who wants to have ever exciting but non real life, an illusion over real life and get addicted to it wasting a real life & not meeting of its challenges, responsibilities & difficulties, which are occasions for growth.
Real-life challenges are real & there isn't escape from reality & real feelings, no matter how perfect this thing will become in imitating real life.
I don't buy into it.
My real life is interesting and challenging enough to choose to resort to virtual escapism & fun.
